page.title: 04Bredwardine; Population.
page.content: Bredwardine and Brobury is an area of scattered farms and cottages and very small population. In 1985 there are 138 people on the Electoral Roll for Bredwardine (of which about 20 live outside our area) and only 16 for Brobury. There are about 25 children under 16 in Bredwardine and only 6 in Brobury. Bredwardine village has a pub, a shop, a Post Office, a Guest House, a farm, a Village Hall, a terrace of 16 houses originally built by South Herefordshire D.C. and now mostly owner-occupied, and 5 Council bungalows. These are all near the cross-roads, and the rest of the population lives in houses in farms scattered along the lanes. Brobury has no shop or Post Office; the former church is now a private house. Two of the one-kilometre squares in our area is not inhabited at all.
